result.execSummary:
The defendant Xou Vue was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.
Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.

AODA and follow up.

DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Xou Vue

records.addlTxt:
Called: 2:58 p.m. 
Clerk: Amy. 
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen for ADA Natalie Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Paige Metzman. 

Date and time set for JPTC.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to DRI Count 2 (Possession of THC/Repeater) and Count 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater); COURT GRANTS.

PLEA>>
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater): NO CONTEST.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation; concurrent with probation currently serving.  
CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow up.  Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two.  Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge. 

Adj:  3:11 p.m.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on June 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  10:37 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Davis Runde for ADA Zibolski. 
Defendant appears with Atty Paige Metzman. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing and waiver of prelim. 

PRELIMINARY HEARING>>>
Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed. Reading Waived; R/J. 
PLEA:  Not guilty. 

Atty Metzman advises they are not ready to proceed with plea hearing today. 

COURT sets TP/JPTC 6/29/22 at 3:00 p.m. 

Adj:  10:40 a.m.

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.    Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 2:38 pm.
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski. Defendant appears, and with Attorney Chad Shamali.
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

Prelim Time Limits Waived. 

PLEA:  NOT GUILTY on Misd.

COURT ORDERS: $1,000 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of controlled substances, except prescriptions taken as prescribed. 
- Prints and photograph.
